messages.subject: Blue Planet
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/29/02 11:41:19 AM Pacific Standard Time, ... We watched that too!!  It was awesome,,,,although I did get quite annoyed that they would
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/29/02 11:41:19 AM Pacific Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> It's called Blue Planet and has some pretty amazing images
> of deep sea life. We both watched slack-jawed as schools of 1,000's of
> sharks descended on unsuspecting prey. We saw a killer whale eat a sea lion
>
> (Casey told me it was a killer whale, I wasn't sure). It's a great show,
> just frame after frame of amazing images.
>

We watched that too!! It was awesome,,,,although I did get quite
annoyed that they would show the different animals breeding and
laying eggs, but NOT show the babies hatching!! I wanted to see
what happened next when the babies were born. Maybe they'll
show that part later? Anyway, I guess it's a series. We watched
the first part on Sunday and then the second part that they showed
right afterwards (and I noticed they did them both all over again two
hours later!). Unfortunately, I missed last night's episode because
I'm such a Roswell junkie, but if there's another part to the Blue
Planet series tonight, I'll be sure to tune in! I'm hoping they will
make it available to borrow from the library eventually.

Andrea Kim :-)
Mommy to two sweeties!
Laura (2/16/96) & Allison (8/31/99)
Kent, WA,,,,,,,,soon to be Seattle!









[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
